{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3550188,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T04:29:47.144Z","cooked":"

Is there a way to turn off pose estimation during autonomous? the reason i want to do this is because when our robot has an estimate it tries to go to the path its told to go to based on the current pose estimation, but the thing is that our robot isnt getting correct estimates on a certain point (when we are very far away from an AprilTag), thus leading the robot moving to the wrong position…

This is a very niche problem but i dont think there is an another solution, Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T04:29:47.144Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":25,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":180.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"Mohammed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61815,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/1","custom_user_title":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3550195,"name":"John Fogarty","username":"JohnFogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T04:42:46.208Z","cooked":"

Just put autonomous checking logic around your pose update vision measurement function.

github.wpilib.org

DriverStation (WPILib API 2025.3.1)

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj, class: DriverStation

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T04:42:46.208Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":245,"readers_count":244,"score":54.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"John Fogarty","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/DriverStation.html#isAutonomous()","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"DriverStation (WPILib API 2025.3.1)","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12688,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550202,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T05:00:13.643Z","cooked":"
Mohammed:

snt getting correct estimates on a certain point (when we are very far away from an AprilTag)

The actual solution is to update the standard deviations based on distance to tag when updating your pose estimator.

You can essentially reject tags altogether by setting the std devs to infinity.

But…where are you going in auto where you’re far from the tags? The reef should be pretty close by at all times

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T05:00:13.643Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/3","custom_user_title":"78 AIR Strike Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550226,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T06:01:17.904Z","cooked":"
ArchdukeTim:

where are you going in auto where you’re far from the tags?

The arrow indicates where the limelight is facing, the circle is the area where the camera start to struggle with correct pose estimation (when we are intaking from human the pose estimation starts getting a ±10cm fault)

image601×515 27.6 KB

Now that i though about i think just making the pose estimation a little better it would solve this problem, the thing is I’m new to pose estimation , would calibrating the camera fix this? this is currently a stock LL4 with no calibration

Also what does standard deviation mean for the camera?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T06:01:38.875Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"Mohammed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61815,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/4","custom_user_title":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550229,"name":"Levi","username":"nobody5690","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nobody5690/{size}/203585_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T06:17:43.696Z","cooked":"

When you create your pose estimator you can pass in standard deviations which control the level with which your pose estimator trusts new poses based on how far they are from the existing pose. WPILib has some docs on tuning them: Pose Estimators — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

If you tune them correctly you should be able to have solid poses even when the tags are untrustworthy.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T06:17:43.696Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":43.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"Levi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/advanced-controls/state-space/state-space-pose-estimators.html#tuning-pose-estimators","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pose Estimators — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49892,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5690AM | https://lumynlabs.com"},"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/5","custom_user_title":"5690AM | https://lumynlabs.com","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550237,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T06:44:13.145Z","cooked":"

The thing is that we are actually using pose estimation for correct alignment at some point in auto, but on another point the pose estimation is incorrect leading to incorrect auto path

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T06:44:13.145Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":22.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"Mohammed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":12688,"username":"JohnFogarty","name":"John Fogarty","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/johnfogarty/{size}/267052_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61815,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/6","custom_user_title":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550239,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T06:46:51.043Z","cooked":"

I’m currently using the default Advantage Kit’s Vision template, so tuning the values in the constants file will fix the incorrect pose issue?

  // Basic filtering thresholds
  public static double maxAmbiguity = 0.3;
  public static double maxZError = 0.75;

  // Standard deviation baselines, for 1 meter distance and 1 tag
  // (Adjusted automatically based on distance and # of tags)
  public static double linearStdDevBaseline = 0.02; // Meters
  public static double angularStdDevBaseline = 0.06; // Radians

  // Standard deviation multipliers for each camera
  // (Adjust to trust some cameras more than others)
  public static double[] cameraStdDevFactors =
      new double[] {
        1.0, // Camera 0
        1.0 // Camera 1
      };

  // Multipliers to apply for MegaTag 2 observations
  public static double linearStdDevMegatag2Factor = 0.5; // More stable than full 3D solve
  public static double angularStdDevMegatag2Factor =
      Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY; // No rotation data available
","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T06:46:51.043Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":71.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"Mohammed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":49892,"username":"nobody5690","name":"Levi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nobody5690/{size}/203585_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61815,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/7","custom_user_title":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550244,"name":"Levi","username":"nobody5690","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nobody5690/{size}/203585_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T06:55:26.224Z","cooked":"

Yes, those would be the numbers to change. You want to find a happy medium where the pose still updates relatively frequently at close distances, but doesn’t become overwhelmed with noisy poses at farther distances.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T06:56:17.097Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":92,"readers_count":91,"score":48.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"Levi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61815,"username":"Mohammed","name":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49892,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5690AM | https://lumynlabs.com"},"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/8","custom_user_title":"5690AM | https://lumynlabs.com","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550267,"name":"4391 Programming Mentor","username":"aveeser","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T11:02:32.080Z","cooked":"

Ideally the tuning would work, but my team never got it perfect either and we are also disabling the vision updates here and there. We just made a simple Boolean object that we set or unset throughout auto sequence. That Boolean enables or disables vision pose updates just like the example given by one of the first responses.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-07T11:02:32.080Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":78,"readers_count":77,"score":15.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494612,"topic_slug":"turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto","display_username":"4391 Programming Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56643,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/turn-off-pose-estimation-during-auto/494612/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3550351,"name":"Steven Pearson","username":"spearson23","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/779978/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-07T14:20:23.414Z","cooked":"

Simplest solution is to reject poses from tags far away:

// Reject if average tag distance is greater than 4 meters away
if (mt2.avgTagDist > 4) {
    shouldRejectUpdate = true;
}

You could also update the stddevs based on distance like others have suggested. We do this based on distance and number of tags seen with this formula. We didn’t invent formula, we found from Team Scream (4522), but have since found several teams using it so not sure where it originally came from:

RobotContainer.drivetrain.addVisionMeasurement(
    mt2.pose,
    mt2.timestampSeconds,
    VecBuilder.fill(
        Math.pow(0.5, mt2.tagCount) * 2 * mt2.avgTagDist, 
        Math.pow(0.5, mt2.tagCount) * 2 * mt2.avgTagDist, 
        Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
    ));
